page.title: 05Much Marcle Flora and Fauna
page.content: There are plenty of wild flowers in Much Marcle but a lot are being picked.The flowers we see in summer are,buttercups,dandelions,daisies, clovers,sorrel,bugle,yarrow,ragwort, speedwell and herbrobert.Other flowers can be found at other times in the year.These are some,snowdrops,ladies slipper and foxgloves.There are many varieties of trees in Much Marcle including,oak,elderberry and hawthorn.Elderberries are small and red and are used to make wine.Hawthorn trees have small white flowers which blossom in the spring.There are many different animals and birds in our area.There are rabbits,pheasants,sparrows,crows, squirrels and magpies.You rarely see red squirrels or beavers but it exciting to see them.
